org.threadly.concurrent

Class TaskSchedulerDistributor.KeyBasedScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.TaskExecutorDistributor.KeyBasedExecutor
      • org.threadly.concurrent.TaskSchedulerDistributor.KeyBasedScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterSchedulerInterface
    Enclosing class:
    TaskSchedulerDistributor

    protected class TaskSchedulerDistributor.KeyBasedScheduler
extends TaskExecutorDistributor.KeyBasedExecutor
implements SubmitterSchedulerInterface
    Simple simple scheduler implementation that runs all executions and scheduling on a given key.

        Parameters:

        delayInMs - time in milliseconds to wait to execute task

      • scheduleWithFixedDelay

        public void scheduleWithFixedDelay(java.lang.Runnable task,
                          long initialDelay,
                          long recurringDelay)
        Description copied from interface: SimpleSchedulerInterface
        Schedule a recurring task to run. The recurring delay time will be from the point where execution finished.
        Specified by:
        scheduleWithFixedDelay in interface SimpleSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed.
        initialDelay - delay in milliseconds until first run.
        recurringDelay - delay in milliseconds for running task after last finish.

      • submit

        public ListenableFuture<?> submit(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Submit a task to run as soon as possible. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed

      • submit

        public <T> ListenableFuture<T> submit(java.lang.Runnable task,
                             T result)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Submit a task to run as soon as possible. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed
        result - result to be returned from resulting future .get() when runnable completes
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed

      • submit

        public <T> ListenableFuture<T> submit(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Submit a Callable to run as soon as possible. This is needed when a result needs to be consumed from the callable.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - callable to be executed
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed and get the result of the callable

      • submitScheduled

        public ListenableFuture<?> submitScheduled(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                  long delayInMs)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Schedule a task with a given delay. There is a slight increase in load when using submitScheduled over schedule. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submitScheduled in interface SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to execute
        delayInMs - time in milliseconds to wait to execute task
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed

                                      T result,
                                      long delayInMs)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Schedule a task with a given delay. There is a slight increase in load when using submitScheduled over schedule. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submitScheduled in interface SubmitterSchedulerInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to execute
        result - result to be returned from resulting future .get() when runnable completes
        delayInMs - time in milliseconds to wait to execute task
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed
